articles.title: Earth Spins Faster: What Could Happen

articles.title: Zardari urges preparedness ahead of heavy rains in Sindh

articles.summary: The Symposium of Episcopal Conferences of Africa and Madagascar (SECAM) affirms that the climate crisis is both a moral and ecological emergency. Africa bears disproportionate impacts, despite contributing least to global emissions. The conference will take place in Malagasy capital, capital of Madagascar.

articles.title: Sticks against the sea: As oceans rise, these fishermen in West Africa refused to wait
articles.author: Tapsir Diakhaté/Provided
articles.summary: Rising seas caused by a rapidly warming climate have pushed waves into rice fields and eaten into communities where fishermen keep their homes. West Africa, especially Senegal, is among the most vulnerable areas in the world to rising sea level levels. West African villages are losing several meters of shoreline every year. In Senegal, fishermen are building a barrier with sticks to slow the sea's advance.
